title: Can someone help me
body:
I have recently purchased {{champion:268}}  because of all the great plays i see Bjergsen and Faker do but {{champion:268}} is quite hard to play. Can anyone help me and give some advice to do well as Azir

Ty     0j0j0

replies.body:
Best advice: Don't buy champs simply because you see pros do stuff.
Second best advice: If you don't follow the best advice, just be careful and take baby steps, starting with customs for practice

That being said, just take W first level, be mana conservative. The second an enemy champion walks into soldier range, right click them until they leave. Farm till mid game. When you get someone low, your all in combo is W (insert more Ws until you have max soldiers, or 1 less than max) Q (preferably so the soldiers stand on the opposite side of a champ), E (try to hit the enemy champion if they're in between you and your soldiers), right click.

W Q E click wait ignite

What champs do you normally play anyway?
Generally i play {{champion:69}} {{champion:245}} {{champion:157}}  and {{champion:238}}  ty for ur help :P

Well pretend Azir is like Zed, except the button to create shadows is separate from the one to teleport to them, and instead of using E for shadow slash, you right click. And you have multiple shadows.

Though only spawn maximum soldiers at once if you feel you're safe - as if you were considering whether you should Zed ult or not.
R is bad when used offensively because you can push people away from your soldiers and you lose your panic button :(

The reason you don't want to put all soldiers down and Q anymore, is because Q only allows for one soldier's damage (nerf), and after you expire all your soldiers you don't have an escape option{{summoner:4}} . Generally Azir doesn't really have an all in *combo* he relies on auto-attacks, so if you're great at kiting{{champion:67}} , you should be decent at Azir :) 
Just remember, W is your main (probably your only) real damage dealer mid-late-game, never expire all your W's unless there's nobody around and you're defending a turrent, or you're about to go for an all-in, or you're backing and just want to clear the wave quickly

Fakers Azir is ok it's not the best however, you would be better off looking at Coco or Easyhoon playing him. Don't blow your ult to early, hold onto it until opportune moment. Also don't use passive pointlessly no point throwing up a tower if you're not going to be around to make best use of it
